001package io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics;
002
003import static io.github.ai4ci.abm.ModelNav.baseline;
004
005import java.util.function.Predicate;
006
007import io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutablePersonHistory;
008import io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutablePersonHistory.Builder;
009import io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutablePersonState;
010import io.github.ai4ci.abm.ModelNav;
011import io.github.ai4ci.abm.OutbreakState;
012import io.github.ai4ci.abm.Person;
013import io.github.ai4ci.abm.PersonState;
014import io.github.ai4ci.abm.TestResult;
015import io.github.ai4ci.abm.TestResult.Result;
016import io.github.ai4ci.abm.TestResult.Type;
017import io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics.State.BehaviourState;
018import io.github.ai4ci.util.Conversions;
019import io.github.ai4ci.util.Sampler;
020
021/**
022 * Utility methods for state transitions, behavior modifications, and testing
023 * logic within the agent-based modeling framework.
024 *
025 * <p>
026 * This class provides reusable implementations for common state machine
027 * operations including mobility adjustments, testing procedures, compliance
028 * management, and controlled state transitions with branching support.
029 *
030 * <h2>Key Functionality Areas</h2>
031 * <ul>
032 * <li><b>Testing Interfaces</b>: Default interfaces for PCR testing
033 * behaviors</li>
034 * <li><b>Mobility Control</b>: Methods for modifying agent sociability based on
035 * symptoms and compliance</li>
036 * <li><b>Behavior Restoration</b>: Gradual restoration of normal behavior after
037 * restrictions</li>
038 * <li><b>State Branching</b>: Controlled temporary state transitions with
039 * automatic return paths</li>
040 * <li><b>Testing Logic</b>: Screening and diagnostic testing with eligibility
041 * checks</li>
042 * </ul>
043 *
044 * @see State
045 * @see StateMachine
046 * @see BehaviourState
047 */
048public class StateUtils {
049
050        /**
051         * Interface for behavior states that require no testing or history updates.
052         *
053         * <p>
054         * Used for baseline behaviors or states where testing is not applicable
055         * (e.g., deceased agents, non-reactive behaviors). Provides empty
056         * implementation to satisfy interface requirements without adding testing
057         * overhead.
058         */
059        public static interface DefaultNoTesting extends State.BehaviourState {
060                /**
061                 * Empty history update - no testing or state modifications occur.
062                 */
063                @Override
064                default public void updateHistory(
065                                ImmutablePersonHistory.Builder builder, PersonState person,
066                                StateMachineContext context, Sampler rng
067                ) {}
068        }
069
070        /**
071         * Interface for behavior states that perform PCR testing when symptomatic.
072         *
073         * <p>
074         * This default implementation automatically triggers PCR testing when: -
075         * Person has been symptomatic for 2 consecutive days AND - Person is
076         * compliant with testing protocols AND - Person has not been recently tested
077         * (within disease incubation period)
078         *
079         * <p>
080         * The timing threshold (2 days) prevents premature testing while ensuring
081         * timely intervention after symptom onset.
082         */
083        public static interface DoesPCRIfSymptomatic extends State.BehaviourState {
084                /**
085                 * Default history update that automatically seeks PCR testing when
086                 * symptomatic.
087                 *
088                 * @param builder builder for person history updates
089                 * @param person  current person state
090                 * @param context state machine context
091                 * @param rng     random number generator
092                 */
093                @Override
094                default public void updateHistory(
095                                ImmutablePersonHistory.Builder builder, PersonState person,
096                                StateMachineContext context, Sampler rng
097                ) {
098                        seekPcrIfSymptomatic(builder, person, context, 2);
099                }
100        }
101
102        /**
103         * Branches all people to specified behavior without filtering.
104         *
105         * Convenience method that applies to entire population without filters.
106         *
107         * @param current   current outbreak state
108         * @param behaviour target behavior state
109         */
110        public static void branchPeopleTo(
111                        OutbreakState current, State.BehaviourState behaviour
112        ) {
113                branchPeopleTo(current, behaviour, p -> true);
114        }
115
116//      private static double decayToZero(double p, double rate) {
117//              return decayTo(p, 0, rate);
118//      }
119
120        /**
121         * Branches filtered people to specified behavior state.
122         *
123         * <p>
124         * Forces selected people to temporary behavior state while preserving
125         * current state in branch stack for later recovery. Dead people are
126         * excluded.
127         *
128         * @param current   current outbreak state
129         * @param behaviour target behavior state
130         * @param filter    predicate to select which people to modify
131         */
132        public static void branchPeopleTo(
133                        OutbreakState current, State.BehaviourState behaviour,
134                        Predicate<Person> filter
135        ) {
136                ModelNav.people(current).filter(filter)
137                                .filter(p -> !p.getCurrentState().isDead()).forEach(ps -> {
138                                        ps.getStateMachine().forceTo(behaviour);
139                                });
140        }
141
142        /**
143         * Branches single person to specified behavior state.
144         *
145         * <p>
146         * Preserves current state in branch stack and returns the target behavior
147         * for immediate use in state transitions.
148         *
149         * @param current   person state to modify
150         * @param behaviour target behavior state
151         * @return the target behavior state for chaining
152         */
153        public static State.BehaviourState branchTo(
154                        PersonState current, State.BehaviourState behaviour
155        ) {
156                current.getEntity().getStateMachine().rememberCurrentState(behaviour);
157                return behaviour;
158        }
159
160        /**
161         * Applies gradual compliance deterioration over time (fatigue effect).
162         *
163         * <p>
164         * Reduces compliance modifier linearly toward zero using configuration
165         * deterioration rate. Models behavioral fatigue in sustained restrictions.
166         *
167         * @param builder builder for person state modifications
168         * @param person  current person state to evaluate
169         */
170        public static void complianceFatigue(
171                        ImmutablePersonState.Builder builder, PersonState person
172        ) {
173                if (person.isCompliant()) {
174                        builder.setComplianceModifier(
175                                        linearToZero(
176                                                        person.getComplianceModifier(),
177                                                        ModelNav.modelParam(person)
178                                                                        .getComplianceDeteriorationRate()
179                                        )
180                        );
181                }
182        }
183
184        /**
185         * Restores compliance modifier toward baseline over time.
186         *
187         * <p>
188         * Increases compliance modifier linearly toward 1.0 using configuration
189         * improvement rate. Used during recovery or improved compliance scenarios.
190         *
191         * @param builder builder for person state modifications
192         * @param person  current person state to evaluate
193         */
194        public static void complianceRestoreSlowly(
195                        ImmutablePersonState.Builder builder, PersonState person
196        ) {
197                if (person.isCompliant()) {
198                        builder
199                                        .setComplianceModifier(
200                                                        linearToOne(
201                                                                        person.getComplianceModifier(),
202                                                                        ModelNav.modelParam(person)
203                                                                                        .getComplianceImprovementRate()
204                                                        )
205                                        );
206                }
207        }
208
209        /**
210         * Creates a timed behavior state that automatically returns after i
211         * iterations.
212         *
213         * <p>
214         * Wraps a target state to automatically revert after specified iterations.
215         * Uses state machine branching to preserve the baseline state and recover
216         * automatically when countdown expires.
217         *
218         * @param i     number of iterations before automatic return
219         * @param state target behavior state to temporarily apply
220         * @return a wrapped state that automatically reverts after countdown
221         */
222        public static State.BehaviourState countdown(
223                        int i, State.BehaviourState state
224        ) {
225
226                return new State.BehaviourState() {
227                        @Override
228                        public String getName() { return state.getName(); }
229
230                        @Override
231                        public State.BehaviourState nextState(
232                                        io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutablePersonState.Builder builder,
233                                        PersonState current, StateMachineContext context, Sampler rng
234                        ) {
235                                var out = state.nextState(builder, current, context, rng);
236                                if (out != state) { return out; }
237                                if (i <= 1) { return context.pullBehaviour(); }
238                                return countdown(i - 1, out);
239                        }
240
241                        @Override
242                        public void updateHistory(
243                                        Builder builder, PersonState current,
244                                        StateMachineContext context, Sampler rng
245                        ) {
246                                state.updateHistory(builder, current, context, rng);
247                        }
248
249                };
250        }
251
252        /**
253         * Applies exponential decay toward target value based on rate.
254         *
255         * <p>
256         * Modifies parameter p by decaying it toward target using the specified
257         * rate. The rate is converted to a probability for the decay step. Used for
258         * smooth transitions in mobility or compliance modifiers.
259         *
260         * @param p      current parameter value to modify
261         * @param target target value to decay toward (e.g., 0 for reduction, 1 for
262         *               restoration)
263         * @param rate   decay rate controlling speed of change (higher = faster)
264         * @return the modified parameter value after applying decay step
265         */
266        public static double decayTo(double p, double target, double rate) {
267                return p + (target - p) * Conversions.probabilityFromRate(rate);
268        }
269
270        private static double decayToOne(double p, double rate) {
271                return decayTo(p, 1, rate);
272        }
273
274        /**
275         * Self-isolation behavior applied only if person is compliant.
276         *
277         * <p>
278         * Models advisory-based isolation where compliance determines adherence to
279         * recommendations rather than enforced restrictions. Used in scenarios where
280         * isolation is suggested but not mandatory.
281         *
282         * @param builder builder for person state modifications
283         * @param person  current person state to evaluate
284         */
285        public static void decreaseSociabilityIfCompliant(
286                        ImmutablePersonState.Builder builder, PersonState person
287        ) {
288                selfIsolateIfCompliant(builder, person);
289        }
290
291        /**
292         * Applies self-isolation mobility reduction if person is compliant AND
293         * symptomatic.
294         *
295         * <p>
296         * This is typically used for voluntary isolation scenarios where compliance
297         * determines whether the isolation measures are followed. Side effects:
298         * <ul>
299         * <li>Sets mobility modifier to self-isolation depth if compliant</li>
300         * <li>No action taken if person is non-compliant</li>
301         * </ul>
302         *
303         * @param builder builder for person state modifications
304         * @param person  current person state to evaluate
305         */
306        public static void decreaseSociabilityIfSymptomatic(
307                        ImmutablePersonState.Builder builder, PersonState person
308        ) {
309                if (person.isSymptomatic()) {
310                        decreaseSociabilityIfCompliant(builder, person);
311                }
312        }
313
314        /**
315         * Gradually decreases mobility modifier each day person is symptomatic.
316         *
317         * <p>
318         * Applies continuous mobility reduction using exponential decay toward the
319         * self-isolation depth. The decay rate is controlled by the organic mobility
320         * change parameter from model configuration.
321         *
322         * @param builder builder for person state modifications
323         * @param person  current person state to evaluate
324         */
325        public static void decreaseSociabilitySlowlyIfSymptomatic(
326                        ImmutablePersonState.Builder builder, PersonState person
327        ) {
328                if (person.isSymptomatic()) {
329                        builder.setMobilityModifier(
330                                        decayTo(
331                                                        person.getMobilityModifier(),
332                                                        ModelNav.baseline(person).getSelfIsolationDepth(),
333                                                        ModelNav.modelParam(person)
334                                                                        .getOrganicRateOfMobilityChange()
335                                        )
336                        );
337                }
338        }
339
340        /**
341         * Applies strict mobility reduction regardless of compliance status.
342         *
343         * <p>
344         * Models enforced lock-down scenarios where mobility restrictions are
345         * mandatory rather than advisory. Sets mobility to the minimum
346         * self-isolation depth defined in the baseline configuration.
347         *
348         * @param builder builder for person state modifications
349         * @param person  current person state to evaluate
350         */
351        public static void decreaseSociabilityStrictly(
352                        ImmutablePersonState.Builder builder, PersonState person
353        ) {
354                builder.setMobilityModifier(baseline(person).getSelfIsolationDepth());
355        }
356
357        /**
358         * Performs diagnostic LFT test and updates reactive testing flag.
359         *
360         * <p>
361         * Similar to PCR testing but uses LFT (Lateral Flow Test) with different
362         * sensitivity characteristics. Sets reactive testing flag.
363         *
364         * @param builder builder for person history updates
365         * @param person  current person state
366         * @param context state machine context
367         * @return the test result generated
368         */
369        public static TestResult doLFT(
370                        ImmutablePersonHistory.Builder builder, PersonState person,
371                        StateMachineContext context
372        ) {
373                var test = TestResult.screeningResultFrom(person, Type.LFT).get();
374                builder.addTodaysTests(test);
375                context.setReactivelyTestedToday(true);
376                return test;
377        }
378
379        /**
380         * Performs diagnostic PCR test and updates reactive testing flag.
381         *
382         * <p>
383         * Used for diagnostic testing triggered by symptoms or risk exposure. Sets
384         * reactive testing flag and adds test result to person's daily history.
385         *
386         * @param builder builder for person history updates
387         * @param person  current person state
388         * @param context state machine context
389         * @return the test result generated
390         */
391        public static TestResult doPCR(
392                        ImmutablePersonHistory.Builder builder, PersonState person,
393                        StateMachineContext context
394        ) {
395                var test = TestResult.resultFrom(person, Type.PCR).get();
396                builder.addTodaysTests(test);
397                context.setReactivelyTestedToday(true);
398                return test;
399        }
400
401        /**
402         * Creates a behavior state that gradually restores mobility over iterations.
403         *
404         * <p>
405         * Applies linear restoration of mobility and transmissibility modifiers
406         * toward baseline while maintaining the wrapped state's logic. Restoration
407         * continues only while the person is asymptomatic.
408         *
409         * @param i     number of iterations over which to restore behavior
410         * @param state target behavior state to apply during restoration
411         * @return a wrapped state that gradually restores behavior
412         */
413        public static State.BehaviourState graduallyRestoreBehaviour(
414                        int i, State.BehaviourState state
415        ) {
416
417                return new State.BehaviourState() {
418
419                        // linear return to 1 as i changes on each call.
420                        private double frac(int i, double p) {
421                                if (i < 1) { i = 1; }
422                                return (1 - p) / i + p;
423                        }
424
425                        @Override
426                        public String getName() { return state.getName(); }
427
428                        @Override
429                        public State.BehaviourState nextState(
430                                        io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutablePersonState.Builder builder,
431                                        PersonState current, StateMachineContext context, Sampler rng
432                        ) {
433                                var out = state.nextState(builder, current, context, rng);
434                                if (i < 1) { return out; }
435                                if (!current.isSymptomatic()) {
436                                        builder.setMobilityModifier(
437                                                        this.frac(i, current.getMobilityModifier())
438                                        );
439                                        builder.setTransmissibilityModifier(
440                                                        this.frac(i, current.getTransmissibilityModifier())
441                                        );
442                                }
443                                return graduallyRestoreBehaviour(i - 1, out);
444                        }
445
446                        /**
447                         * Delegates history updates to the wrapped state without modification.
448                         *
449                         * @param builder builder for person history updates
450                         * @param current person state to evaluate
451                         * @param context state machine context
452                         * @param rng     random number generator
453                         */
454                        @Override
455                        public void updateHistory(
456                                        Builder builder, PersonState current,
457                                        StateMachineContext context, Sampler rng
458                        ) {
459                                state.updateHistory(builder, current, context, rng);
460                        }
461
462                };
463        }
464
465        /**
466         * Checks if person has high risk of being infectious and is compliant.
467         *
468         * <p>
469         * Evaluates if person's probability of being infectious today exceeds the
470         * specified cutoff and if they are compliant with testing protocols. Used to
471         * identify individuals who should be prioritized for testing or isolation.
472         *
473         * @param person current person state to evaluate
474         * @param cutoff probability threshold for high risk of infection
475         * @return true if person is high risk and compliant, false otherwise
476         */
477        public static boolean isHighRiskOfInfectionAndCompliant(
478                        PersonState person, double cutoff
479        ) {
480                var pInf = person.getProbabilityInfectiousToday();
481                return pInf > cutoff && person.isCompliant();
482        }
483
484        /**
485         * Checks eligibility for LFT testing based on recent test history.
486         *
487         * <p>
488         * Uses shorter restriction period (2 days) since LFTs are typically used
489         * more frequently than PCR tests.
490         *
491         * @param person current person state to evaluate
492         * @return true if LFT testing is allowed, false if tested within 2 days
493         */
494        public static boolean isLFTTestingAllowed(PersonState person) {
495                return !person.isRecentlyTested(Type.LFT, 2) && person.isCompliant();
496        }
497
498        /**
499         * Checks eligibility for PCR testing based on recent test history.
500         *
501         * <p>
502         * Prevents excessive testing by ensuring person hasn't been tested within
503         * the disease incubation period defined in configuration.
504         *
505         * @param person current person state to evaluate
506         * @return true if PCR testing is allowed, false if recently tested
507         */
508        public static boolean isPCRTestingAllowed(PersonState person) {
509                return !person.isRecentlyTested(Type.PCR) && person.isCompliant();
510        }
511
512        /**
513         * Checks if person received a positive test result today.
514         *
515         * <p>
516         * Scans today's test results for positive outcomes. Primarily used with LFT
517         * results since they provide immediate feedback.
518         *
519         * @param person current person state to evaluate
520         * @return true if positive test result exists for today
521         */
522        public static boolean isPositiveTestToday(PersonState person) {
523                return ModelNav.history(person).stream()
524                                .flatMap(h -> h.getTodaysTests().stream()).anyMatch(
525                                                tr -> tr.resultOnDay(person.getTime()).equals(Result.POSITIVE)
526                                );
527        }
528
529        /**
530         * Checks if person has been symptomatic for specified days and is compliant.
531         *
532         * <p>
533         * Used to determine if symptom-driven testing or isolation should be
534         * triggered based on consecutive symptom duration and compliance status.
535         *
536         * @param person current person state to evaluate
537         * @param days   number of consecutive symptomatic days required
538         * @return true if symptomatic for specified days and compliant, false
539         *         otherwise
540         */
541        public static boolean isSymptomaticAndCompliant(
542                        PersonState person, int days
543        ) {
544                return person.isSymptomaticConsecutively(days) && person.isCompliant();
545        }
546
547        private static double linearTo(double p, double target, double delta) {
548                if (p - delta > target) { return p - delta; }
549                if (p + delta < target) { return p + delta; }
550                return target;
551        }
552
553        private static double linearToOne(double p, double delta) {
554                return linearTo(p, 1, delta);
555        }
556
557        private static double linearToZero(double p, double delta) {
558                return linearTo(p, 0, delta);
559        }
560
561        /**
562         * Applies individual PCR screening test based on probability.
563         *
564         * @param builder              builder for person history updates
565         * @param ps                   current person state
566         * @param screeningProbability probability of screening test occurring
567         * @param rng                  random number generator for probability check
568         */
569        public static void randomlyScreen(
570                        ImmutablePersonHistory.Builder builder, PersonState ps,
571                        double screeningProbability, Sampler rng
572        ) {
573                if (rng.bern(screeningProbability)) { screenPCR(builder, ps); }
574        }
575
576        /**
577         * Applies random screening PCR tests to eligible population.
578         *
579         * <p>
580         * Selects living people with available history builders and applies
581         * screening probability check. Throws exception if called at wrong lifecycle
582         * timing.
583         *
584         * @param current current outbreak state
585         * @param rng     random number generator for probability checks
586         */
587        public static void randomlyScreen(OutbreakState current, Sampler rng) {
588                ModelNav.people(current).filter(p -> !p.getCurrentState().isDead())
589                                .forEach(ps -> {
590                                        if (!ps.getNextHistory().isPresent()) {
591                                                throw new RuntimeException(
592                                                                "Tried to update screening after at wrong time in lifecycle"
593                                                );
594                                        }
595                                        randomlyScreen(
596                                                        ps.getNextHistory().get(), ps.getCurrentState(),
597                                                        current.getScreeningProbability(), rng
598                                        );
599                                });
600        }
601
602        /**
603         * Resets mobility and transmissibility modifiers to baseline (1.0).
604         *
605         * <p>
606         * Immediately restores normal behavior without gradual transition. Used when
607         * forced behavior reset is needed (e.g., policy changes, state transitions).
608         *
609         * @param builder builder for person state modifications
610         * @param current person state to evaluate
611         */
612        public static void resetBehaviour(
613                        ImmutablePersonState.Builder builder, PersonState current
614        ) {
615                builder.setMobilityModifier(1.0);
616                builder.setTransmissibilityModifier(1.0);
617        }
618
619        /**
620         * Unconditional gradual restoration of mobility and transmissibility to
621         * baseline.
622         *
623         * <p>
624         * Applies exponential decay restoration toward full mobility (1.0)
625         * regardless of symptomatic status. Uses the organic mobility change rate
626         * from configuration to control restoration speed.
627         *
628         * @param builder builder for person state modifications
629         * @param person  current person state to evaluate
630         */
631        public static void restoreSociabilitySlowly(
632                        ImmutablePersonState.Builder builder, PersonState person
633        ) {
634                builder
635                                .setMobilityModifier(
636                                                decayToOne(
637                                                                person.getMobilityModifier(),
638                                                                ModelNav.modelParam(person)
639                                                                                .getOrganicRateOfMobilityChange()
640                                                )
641                                );
642                builder
643                                .setTransmissibilityModifier(
644                                                decayToOne(
645                                                                person.getTransmissibilityModifier(),
646                                                                ModelNav.modelParam(person)
647                                                                                .getOrganicRateOfMobilityChange()
648                                                )
649                                );
650        }
651
652        /**
653         * Gradually restores mobility and transmissibility toward baseline when
654         * asymptomatic.
655         *
656         * <p>
657         * Used during recovery phase to transition from restricted to normal
658         * behavior. Restoration occurs only when person is asymptomatic, preventing
659         * premature restoration while infectious.
660         *
661         * @param builder builder for person state modifications
662         * @param person  current person state to evaluate
663         */
664        public static void restoreSociabilitySlowlyIfAsymptomatic(
665                        ImmutablePersonState.Builder builder, PersonState person
666        ) {
667                if (!person.isSymptomatic()) {
668                        restoreSociabilitySlowly(builder, person);
669                }
670        }
671
672        /**
673         * Returns all people to their previous behavior states from branches.
674         *
675         * <p>
676         * Reverses branching operations by recovering previous states from the state
677         * machine branch stack. Excludes dead people.
678         *
679         * @param current current outbreak state
680         */
681        public static void returnPeopleFromBranch(OutbreakState current) {
682                ModelNav.people(current).forEach(ps -> {
683                        if (!ps.getCurrentState().isDead()) {
684                                ps.getStateMachine().returnFromBranch();
685                        }
686                });
687        }
688
689        /**
690         * Performs asymptomatic screening LFT test without reactivity tracking.
691         *
692         * @param builder builder for person history updates
693         * @param person  current person state
694         * @return the screening test result
695         */
696        public static TestResult screenLFT(
697                        ImmutablePersonHistory.Builder builder, PersonState person
698        ) {
699                var test = TestResult.resultFrom(person, Type.LFT).get();
700                return test;
701        }
702
703        /**
704         * Performs asymptomatic screening PCR test without reactive testing flag.
705         *
706         * <p>
707         * Used for routine screening rather than symptom-driven diagnostics. Does
708         * not set reactive testing flag since this is not symptom-initiated.
709         *
710         * @param builder builder for person history updates
711         * @param person  current person state
712         * @return the screening test result
713         */
714        public static TestResult screenPCR(
715                        ImmutablePersonHistory.Builder builder, PersonState person
716        ) {
717                var test = TestResult.screeningResultFrom(person, Type.PCR).get();
718                builder.addTodaysTests(test);
719                return test;
720        }
721
722        /**
723         * Performs diagnostic PCR test with 1-day symptom threshold. Seek a test if
724         * any symptoms (and compliant, and not recently tested)
725         *
726         * @param builder builder for person history updates
727         * @param person  current person state
728         * @param context state machine context
729         */
730        public static void seekPcrIfSymptomatic(
731                        ImmutablePersonHistory.Builder builder, PersonState person,
732                        StateMachineContext context
733        ) {
734                seekPcrIfSymptomatic(builder, person, context, 1);
735        }
736
737        /**
738         * The person will test themselves using PCR (immediately) if they are
739         * symptomatic consecutively for a number of days, compliant and they have
740         * not recently been tested. Recent here is defined as they have had a PCR
741         * test within the last presumed incubation period of the disease
742         *
743         * @param builder builder for person history updates
744         * @param person  current person state
745         * @param context state machine context
746         * @param days    number of consecutive symptomatic days required to trigger
747         *                testing
748         *
749         */
750        public static void seekPcrIfSymptomatic(
751                        ImmutablePersonHistory.Builder builder, PersonState person,
752                        StateMachineContext context, int days
753        ) {
754                if (isSymptomaticAndCompliant(person, days)
755                                && isPCRTestingAllowed(person)) {
756                        doPCR(builder, person, context);
757                }
758        }
759
760        /**
761         * If the person is compliant reduce their mobility to the minimum. If not
762         * compliant then if partial flag is set they will reduce their mobility to a
763         * level scaled by their level of compliance.
764         */
765        private static void selfIsolateIfCompliant(
766                        ImmutablePersonState.Builder builder, PersonState person
767        ) {
768                if (person.isCompliant()) {
769                        // non compliant people
770                        builder.setMobilityModifier(baseline(person).getSelfIsolationDepth());
771                }
772        }
773
774        /**
775         * Retrieves previous behavior state from branch stack.
776         *
777         * <p>
778         * Used during state transitions to recover from temporary branched states.
779         *
780         * @param context state machine context containing branch stack
781         * @return the previous behavior state from branch
782         */
783        public static State.BehaviourState toLastBranchPoint(
784                        StateMachineContext context
785        ) {
786                return context.pullBehaviour();
787        }
788
789}
